headline: The quiet philanthropists: Premji Foundation, Tata Trusts match social spending of top Nifty companies
intro: As per the reported financials, the eponymous not-for-profit entity of billionaire Azim Premji spent  ?1,528 crore on philanthropy in 2024. That was more than twice the  ?699.31 crore spent by the Tata Trusts in the same year, according to financials filed by the entity.
imagecaption: To be sure, unlike philanthropic entities that are not bound by any regulation in terms of amounts to be spent, enterprises are mandated to spend a portion of their profits on CSR initiatives.

headline: ONGC Q4 Results: PSU Oil major's net profit drops 20% YoY to  ?8,856 crore, final dividend of  ?1.25/share declared
intro: PSU giant ONGC's net profit dropped 20% to  ?8,856 crore in the Jan-Mar quarter results released on 21 May 2025. The Oil major also declared a final dividend issue along with its fourth quarter results. Shares closed lower ahead of the announcement.
imagecaption: ONGC announced its fourth quarter results along with a final dividend on Wednesday, 21 May 2025.

headline: Major oil & gas discovery expected from blocks offered in OALP rounds, says Oil India CMD
intro: The blocks won under the ninth round take OIL's total exploration acreage from 60,000 sq. km to 110,000 sq. km. Over 47,000 sq. km of the newly awarded acreage lies in deep and ultradeep offshore waters.
imagecaption: Ranjit Rath, chairman and managing director of Oil India Ltd. (Bloomberg)

headline: ONGC considers foraying into regasified LNG biz as demand for natural gas rises
intro: There has been a major policy focus on LNG amid India's energy transition journey as it is considered to be a cleaner fuel compared to crude oil. The government aims increase the share of natural gas in the country's energy basket from 7% currently to 15% by 2030.
imagecaption: There has been a major policy focus on LNG amid India's energy transition journey as it is considered to be a cleaner fuel compared to crude oil
